ratings.comment: Although he means well, the lectures are very hard to understand. The tests are extremely difficult and they don't give you hardly any resources to study.

Professor Karle's handwriting is impossible to read. His train of thought is impossible to follow. His demo flopped (and this is why no one uses matches). He seems tired and bored with teaching undergrads. Overall, the entire course is poorly designed. The lectures didn't teach me anything and shouldn't be mandatory.

Out of all the physics professors he is eh. He truly cares about students, only professor who took time for student questions during lecture, but is so smart he has trouble explaining content in terms student understands. Just makes a hard course a little more challenging. Exams were pretty challenging as well.

Dr. Karle is a very smart, intelligent person who brings years of experience to his teaching of this course. He really emphasizes and practices the whole idea of active learning. He does not have the loudest voice, which makes it hard to hear him at times. He is always stopping to ask if people have questions, which is great.

Lectures were so confusing and useless that going to them were more harmful to your grade than not going. Mumbled a lot, very difficult to understand, and often made mistakes. I only learned the material from pre-lecture videos and my TA discussion.

Professor Karle is beyond knowledgable, but I sometimes feel as though he is just a physicist and not a physics professor. He knows what he's talking about, but does not explain things in a way students can understand. While he does genuinely care about students, that does not negate that his teaching is subpar.

He does not try to trick you like the other professor. Sometimes doesn't teach the material well in lecture, but clarifies in office hours. He is straightforward with his exam questions and actually cares about you learning the material.

Lectures are literally trash. I have to sit in them with headphones on to not confuse myself from his horrible explanations. My TA is the only reason I was able to survive the semester. SO FRUSTRATING and I had to read every page of the textbook to understand the most basic underlying concepts that he couldn't even explain in person. PLZ avoid.
Hes a good guy. Willing to help & definitely wants you to do well. Its a lot easier to learn from him outside of lecture, so definitely take advantage of office hours
Lectures are poorly thought out. Often times I leave more confused than I had started. However, he does care and is super helpful in office hours.

not a very good lecturer. Lectures are incoherent and all over the place. Does good demos which does help with learning some concepts but the demos are rushed and not explained well. If you want to actually learn the content of the class, you definitely need to seek outside sources for help.

Here's the thing. Truthfully, he literally does not know how to express the concepts clearly or concisely. But, it's not because he doesn't want to. It's clear that he cares and wants everyone to do well. If you ask him a question about a problem, he will go through it line-by-line with you. You just have to ask

He is the worst lecturer I have ever had. Mumbles, his explanations make zero sense, doesn't explain his logic behind solving problems, focuses on diagrams that are largely unimportant, and is rude when asked about logistical issues like the clickers. It's a shame because the other prof who teaches with him for this class is awesome.
He is s wonderful professor. I found him very intriguing , and was willing to help if asked. I love Physics. I really enjoyed his Antarctica talks.
Lectures are not very well structured; he often makes mistakes while trying trying to work out problems on white board. Practice exams not like exams at all. He did us dirty with that final.

Mumbles through lecture a lot. His demos hardly every work. Has a lot less concept questions on the exams than Dasu, so that's good. I liked Karle better than Dasu, but neither sparked my interest in physics and you'll just be glad when the semester is over.
Good guy, definitely willing to help you if you need it. The accent is pretty slight, nothing too bad. Attend lectures and discussions and you will be fine.

This guy is kind of funny and does some demos, but I don't think that he taught a whole lot. The homework that he gave wasn't covered in lecture so you had to do a lot of it on your own. He also talks about the south pole a lot. His exams were pretty easy though.
Doesn't seem to care in lecture, makes mistakes on the board and doesn't realize it. I didn't really have a problem with his accent. Easy exams though.
Wrote on the board small and had a hard grading curve.

This guy is terrible. His lectures are completely unclear and he has terrible powerpoint slides. You cannot take notes or follow anything that goes on in lecture. His test was really confusing but pretty easy, this kind of messed up the curve though. He has no interest in teaching and therefore puts forth no effort and it shows. BAD BAD BAD!

A very lazy man, he made the TA's write a test because he forgot about it.  He makes me miss Yibin Pan.  Doesn't really know what's going on in lectures and makes quite a few mistakes...but not a very difficult professor.
hot. that's about all he's got going, but....hot.
Bad professor. Comes unprepared to lecture, makes mistakes almost every class, has an accent that's hard to understand. Atleast his tests were easy.
